alert.note: Alert for Eastern Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 10:08PM EST until January 07 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches. * WHERE...In Maryland, Extreme Western Allegany and Garrett Counties. In Virginia, Eastern Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Mineral and Eastern Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may fall at 1 inch or greater per hour later this evening. Visibility will drop down to one quarter mile or less during the heaviest snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
